citation.article-title: Classification of Pseudomonas azotocolligans Anderson 1955, 132, in the genus Sphingomonas as Sphingomonas trueperi sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Sphingomonas trueperi sp. nov.

Sphingomonas trueperi (true'per.i. N. L. gen. n. trueperi, of Trüper, in honor of Hans G. Trüper, a German microbiologist, in recognition of his numerous contributions to the taxonomy of the Proteobacteria)
Sphingomonas trueperi is a gram-negative, rod-shaped, non-spore-forming, motile, peritrichously flagellated organism (5).
Colonies are yellow, circular, entire, low convex, and smooth.
Growth occurs in the presence of 10% sodium chloride and 0.02% sodium azide.
Oxidase positive.
Catalase positive.
Indole, urease, and arginine dihydrolase are not produced.
β-Galactosidase positive.
Esculin and gelatin are hydrolyzed.

The following compounds are hydrolyzed: p-nitrophenyl-N-acetyl-β-D-glucosaminide, p-nitrophe-nyl-α-L-arabinopyranoside, p-nitrophenyl-β-D-galacuronide, p-nitrophenyl-α-D-glucopyranoside,p-nitrophenyl-β-D-glucopyranoside, p-nitrophenyl-β-D-glucuronidpe, pnitrophenyl-β-D-melibiose, p-nitrophenyl-β-D-xyloside, bis-p-nitrophenylphosphate, p-nitrophenyl-phenyl-phosphonate, p-nitrophenylphosphoryl-choline, 2-deoxythymidine-5'-p-nitrophenyl-phosphate, D-alanine-p-nitroanilide, L-alanine-pnitroanilide, L-arginine-p-nitroanilide, γ-L-glutamate-p-nitroanilide, glutamate-1-p-nitroanilide, glycine-p-nitroanilide, L-lysine-p-nitroanilide, L-phenylalanine-p-nitroanilide, and L-valine-p-nitroanilide.

No acid is produced from D-arabinose, arabonic acid, dextran, α-D-galacturonate, gluconate, glucuronate, inulin, lactobionic acid, L-lyxose, D-maltose, glycogen, α-D-melezitose, α-D-melibiose, L-rhamnose, D-sucrose, α-methyl-D-mannoside, methyl-α-D-glucopyranoside, β-methyl-D-xyloside, mucate, α-D-raffinose, D-ribose, L-sorbose, starch, D-tagatose, L-xylose, dulcitol, m-erythritol, glycerol, i-inositol, maltitol, D-xylitol, and tributyrin.
The G+C content of the DNA is 65.6 mol% (5).
The major isoprenoid quinone is ubiquinone Q-10.
The main component in the polyamine pattern is sym-homospermidine (4).
The major nonpolar fatty acids are 18:1 and 16:0, and the major 2-hydroxy fatty acid is 14:0 2OH.
Sphingoglycolipid, phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidyldimethylethanolamine, and an unknown lipid are the predominant polar lipids.
Phosphatidylmonomethylethanolamine and four unknown lipids are present in minor concentrations.
Isolated from soil.
The type strain is strain NCIMB 9391 (=ATCC 12417=LMG 2142=DSM 7225).
The 16s rDNA sequence has been deposited in the EMBL data bank under accession number X97776.
